website_summaries.verdict: A powerful and versatile scanner that is built to last.
pros: Provides digital and analog operation at both UHF and VHF
Offers 7 watts of power for extended use
IP54-rated to ensure protection against dirt and debris
Large color display is easy to read
cons: Not compatible with software for CHIRP and RT systems

customer_reviews.title: Started Out Great. Screen Now Causes RF Noise On Receive
customer_reviews.text: This started out being a great radio for the money, but about 5 months into ownership, it started to make a noise like a clock ticking when receiving a signal. Some others suggested turning off the clock so it isn't viewed from the main screen, which I did, with no improvement. Changing the screen , like toggling through the Menu screens while receiving a signal, brings more noise hash to the audio. I assume the screen is somehow injecting noise into the radio.
customer_reviews.author: Shortwaver

customer_reviews.title: If you want a DMR HT that is easy to use and quality built.  BUY IT!  You will not be sorry.
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best of the Chinese radios I have ever used. I would say the build and audio quality is as good as Icom, Yaesu, Kenwood, etc. The battery life is very good. You can program analog simplex and repeater frequencies very easily from the keypad. I did it without even reading the instructions. Makes changes while in DMR mode are possible as well. Some may be easier while connected to the computer. Just because of requirement to enter different menu entries versus having everything on the computer screen all at once. I have no regrets buying this radio. It is my go to portable radio now. I would and have recommended this radio to many people.
customer_reviews.author: Dale M.

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money.
customer_reviews.text: I like that this bundle came with extra accessories such as a case and extra antenna which I am currently using. Battery life is excellent. I have been using the radio for about 3 days without charging and I am impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Luis I.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome HT
customer_reviews.text: Too much good to say about it. DMR works perfectly with Motorola DMR repeater. Radio comes with everything needed in the box - radio, antenna, battery, charger, belt clip, programming cable and software. Good internal speaker and get good audio and signal reports from ham operators. Even though it isn't a scanner, the scan speeds or acceptable. After market antenna and external mic I bought for the BF-F8HP fit the HT as well. It feels substantial in hand but is no heavier than the motorola ht. DMR and FM sound awesome on this ht. The battery lasts for a couple days when mostly scanning. I'm hoping for a mobile version with about 50 watts someday.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Anytone AT-D868UV CPS Version II-works fine once one can get through the programming hurdles
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are not as clear as they could be. It would help if the translator of the instruction manual consulted with a native English speaking amateur radio operator. Some of the steps were not as clear as they should have been (a few seemed to missing altogether) and the videos that are on youtube are not up to date. It took a few local hams to help get the wrinkles ironed out, but there are still some glitches with the code plug. However, all that aside, once the radios are programmed, they are great. The radio itself is sturdy and solid. The display is easy to read once one figures out what all is on it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: One solid build DMR radio!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little radio. Ready has a nice build quantity, weights around 11.6ozs with nagoya 771 15.6 whip. It has a very nice display that allows you to see both the zone name and the name of the channel!! I recommend this DMR radio to any ham new to DMR. The only bad thing I see is the stock antenna, it suck; but what stock antenna doesn't suck! With a good aftermarket antenna, it's one heck of a radio to beat!
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great intro rig for DMR or analog ham.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent radio. Feature rich DMR radio. Dual band is a bonus. Ample memory to hold the entire growing DMR "Contact List" of worldwide Amateur Radio operators on DMR, instead of picking and choosing. Programming with the included cable and the downloadable software is intuitive once you figure out the DMR basics. 7 watts on UHF gets me into the local DMR repeater 12 miles away ( his antenna is only at 35 ft.) Very happy. Excellent rig with GPS included for under $170.
customer_reviews.author: Howard Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Unexpected extras.
customer_reviews.text: Came faster than expected. Seller even included protective carrier pouch and 2nd longer antenna, was pleasantly surprised. Bought this radio for it’s good reputation, and the price was right. Radio had latest firmware installed, V2.35 which increased the digital address limit to 200000. Very nice! Overall I am very happy. A new toy to add to my collection. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: LynxZ

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great radio of the money! I bought the the radio to use for work in a manufacturing environment because the radios they have here are useless and don't reach far at all. The range on the anytone at-d868uv is amazing I can hear everything going on from anywhere in the plant. The seller I got it from went above and beyond also by adding in extra items that I was going to purchase later on and now I don't have to.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Great little radio
customer_reviews.text: This was the 3rd DMR radio I've purchased. I had two others, different brands, when I first attempted to get into DMR, but ended up frustrated and gave them away. Someone convinced me not to give up, so I gave it another shot with this radio. I have to say that setup was really simple, as I followed the step by step youtube vids by Bridgecomm Systems. I have used it with 3 different hotspots and I often get feedback from other hams saying that the audio sounds perfect. Would definitely recommend this HT.
customer_reviews.author: Melo Raja

customer_reviews.title: It is a very nice Radio. The quality seems good and the features ...
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased this radio last week. It is a very nice Radio. The quality seems good and the features are very useful. However it gets quite hot when using it and just today it made a horrible noise and now it won't boot up anymore. It just hangs at the boot screen. I will be returning this radio.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew S.

customer_reviews.title: Big Bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: After using a couple different TYT HTs including the 8000d and MD-380 I was really looking forward to using this 868uv. Without a doubt probably the best HT radio I've owed yet. Filtering is good, durable feel, responsive control face and good audio reports. This is a must have for any DMR Ham enthusiast.
customer_reviews.author: KE8DKW

customer_reviews.title: Great DMR radio
customer_reviews.text: My first DMR dual band HT. Excellent quality, easy to understand menus. Code plug software was easy to use and set up for local analog FM and DMR repeaters. Long battery life on receive. Only HT that I could find that could import entire DMR database.
customer_reviews.author: Al Holliday

customer_reviews.title: Nice radio to get into DMR with.
customer_reviews.text: This radio has been great so far. It works great in my area. Eventually I will find how easy it will be to use on the road away from home. But for now, it has been a great way from me to get started in DMR. All the accessories withit have been great as well.
customer_reviews.author: Eugkelly

customer_reviews.title: Love this radio.
customer_reviews.text: Holds all global DMR contacts with plenty of room to spare. Feels solid. Programmable from front face for both analog and digital. Software takes some getting used to, but once you understand it, it makes sense and is easily programmed.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Eckhoff

customer_reviews.title: Excellent audio quality
customer_reviews.text: Large clear display and it was easy to set up. I'm looking forward to many contacts all over the world with this fabulous radio.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: After a disaster with bofang 1701 opted for the anytone. Glad I did. Good radio good price 👍 👌 this seller is on point as well.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron LaBranche

customer_reviews.title: Great Radio
customer_reviews.text: I love this radio FM Analog and Digital. Love the 4 setting for power. The seller is a great person to work with too!!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Really good product
customer_reviews.text: After I saw a couple different videos of how to program it overall it's a really good products it's just something is different about mine that I had to do a different way to program it but overall is pretty good if it's GPS locator deal I'm not sure if it's Bluetooth if it is I'll find out later
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Receiver is not as good as my other Yaesu HTs
customer_reviews.text: Receiver is not as good as my other Yaesu HTs. PTT button can be difficult/stiff to push sometimes. Otherwise works well, Nice color display, Easy to program and use. Battery life is good.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great HT
customer_reviews.text: A truly great radio. Tough to programnif you’re not familiar with DMR, but otherwise a fantastic portable radio.
customer_reviews.author: Jason S. Cote

customer_reviews.title: Smooth As Silk
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be more satisfied. Exchange for a defective display went very smoothly and seller sent return to me by priority mail for fast delivery. Very quick to respond to my emails. They really seem to have their act together! D868 is a great little radio.
customer_reviews.author: Ranger Rick

customer_reviews.title: Great Radio
customer_reviews.text: I've had the D868UV since Christmas. It's an excellent radio for both DMR and analog. I do recommend changing the stock antenna but that's with most handhelds. I'm especially impressed with the frequent firmware updates that bring new features or adds a new option.
customer_reviews.author: B. Gibbs

customer_reviews.title: Great UHF VHF DMR Analog dual band.
customer_reviews.text: Great UHF VHF DMR and analog radio. Well priced. Dual band. Does take some learning to use the codeplug software.
customer_reviews.author: Mark F.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: You can spend more on other radios out there but this packs everything you would need in a DMR radio at a low price. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: HamDude

customer_reviews.title: Good little DMR radio
customer_reviews.text: Once I figured out the codeplug set up, it has been super.
customer_reviews.author: BwB

customer_reviews.title: Good radio
customer_reviews.text: No DMR is easy to use but this is better than most
customer_reviews.author: Techie customer

customer_reviews.title: Great DMR Radio
customer_reviews.text: Nice DMR/Analog HT. Lots of memory, easy to program. Product arrived fast and in new/ original packaging with all the cables, software and instructions. Love this radio!
customer_reviews.author: PC Doc

customer_reviews.title: Well built and functional
customer_reviews.text: One of the best I tried. Works well and has great audio.
customer_reviews.author: Stoneadventures

customer_reviews.title: A good radio at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: A very nice radio, well built and did to use
customer_reviews.author: Rolland A. Krueger

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use.
customer_reviews.text: This product so far has met ALL my expectations! No complaints so far. Use primarily for SARC( Search and rescue) and also when riding and working on "trails in BLM and Forest Service areas".. Need capabilities of dual channel ham radio!!
customer_reviews.author: Tomdb

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use and a great DMR radio for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This radio is an absolute must have in the collection I currently own six other HT radios. The setup was very easy with the computer software and has operated flawlessly since its initial setup I recommend this radio.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie Williams

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for price
customer_reviews.text: I returned my first one due to nothing digital working. Now having the same issue with my second radio. Otherwise a great radio! Will have to return and get a third unfortunately. Its great For the price and loaded with features!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Audio died after 1.5 years...
customer_reviews.text: Liked the radio while it lasted, but at the 1.5 year point the audio stopped working (speaker and jack). Very unexpected- radio was well cared for. Not sure will buy again since could mean a near-annual purchase cycle....
customer_reviews.author: Advocatus

customer_reviews.title: Great radio
customer_reviews.text: Great little radio, I have really enjoyed it and may even buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Bill English

customer_reviews.title: Great HT!
customer_reviews.text: Great HT! Little bit of a learning curve on codeplug programming , but other than that love this radio. KE8LNP
customer_reviews.author: Gary L Houck Jr

customer_reviews.title: Good radio
customer_reviews.text: I really like it so far. It works great and the audio out is loud enough for jeeping without an external speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money !
customer_reviews.text: My first DMR radio and it is all that I expected it to be . Would buy again the 868 is worth the money over the 878 in my option !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Thom

customer_reviews.title: Hard to program.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, but very hard to program. Had it for a month and still can't figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent radio / pager
customer_reviews.text: Excellent radio, solid build. Digital and analog with 2 tone, 5 tone and DTMF support. I'm using it as a 2 tone pager as well in addition to normal use. Sometimes i don't need / want to hear all traffic so this is ideal.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Really a great radio, but it's work in progress
customer_reviews.text: Really a great radio, but it's work in progress. There are tons of firmware upgrades for various minir issues - but overall it's a great radio.
customer_reviews.author: Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: This is a good radio so far. Still learning how to use it, haven't made any transmissions as of yet so will update when I do.
customer_reviews.author: phil

customer_reviews.title: Horrible experience with this radio.
customer_reviews.text: I have had nothing but issues with this radio. The manual functions are very glitchy. Once I updated the band software I can no longer reach a repeater. I plan on contacting the seller. If I still had the box I would return this pos. The positive is if they ever get the firmware updated correctly it has a lot of promise.
customer_reviews.author: david stephens

customer_reviews.title: Dual Band, Dual mode and great audio. This is a winner !!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a CS700, XPR6550, XPR755o, XPR4550 and now this radio. It is unlike the others in that it is a dual band and does digital and analog on VHF and UHF. It other words it does it all. There is a facebook page for the Anytone radio and they keep us up to date with any upgrades available. The audio quality is wonderful, as good or better than my Motorola's.
customer_reviews.author: timOBX

customer_reviews.title: Packed With Features
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these radios to replace a much older set made by a different manufacturer which had suddenly stopped working. These radios came packed with a multitude of features, many of which I was familiar with, though a few of the features I haven't had the opportunity to try out. Setup was an absolute breeze, and had two radios set up for GMRS use within 10 minutes. (I have a valid GMRS license, if you're wondering.) The software, which was included in the box was comprehensive and straightforward. Literally the entire process to get on the air took much less time than I had anticipated. Drop everything and buy these radios! You will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas W P Slatin

customer_reviews.title: This is one of the best radios I have ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best radios I have ever purchased. Great audio quality on both analog and digital. Fast firmware updates allowing for the entire DMR-MARC contact database. Software is not as simple as chirp, but just as easy as any other Amateur DMR radio. Build quality is very good and have received great signal reports. Definitely one of the best analog/dmr handhelds on the market right now. de K7CHM
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Radio
customer_reviews.text: This radio exceeded my expectations, battery is exceptional, easy to use, screen very easy to see... The only Con for this radio is it's extremely loud. On the lowest volume level, you can hear this thing throughout the house, on high volume, the neighbors, maybe even the ISS can hear this thing. If you're driving in a car with the windows down, there's no need for an external speaker, you'll hear it, trust me.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Beefy little radio!
customer_reviews.text: Great little radio. Surprisingly sturdy. Manufacturer is a little behind on the documentation work latest firmware but there are resources to get around that. DMR isn't easy to program but that's just the nature of DMR. CPS software is decent and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: A. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Did not come with programming cable
customer_reviews.text: Good radio, however did not come with programming cable, thinking I received a dud I contacted amazon and then sent replacement right away, replacement came in and again no cable. Attempted to contact seller and did not hear back. Ended up returning. Radio seems like good quality though Attached photos of description and photo of included items which say programming cable. FYI the 868 does not use the normal baofeng type cable it has a chip built into the radio so it just has a pass through cable. Baofeng cables will not work with it.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Niblett

customer_reviews.title: Such a great radio, I bought a second one!
customer_reviews.text: Such a great radio, I bought a second one! this radio is my go-to amateur HT radio. I get good reports when using both DMR and analog. The code plug takes a bit of getting used to programming, but once you figure out, it is pretty straightforward.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff J

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty radio.
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty built radio, built to take punishment. Power output is not as much as advertised. Receive is not as good compared to other radios I own. I was a little let down because I had read so many good thing about this radio. It talks and receives, but not like I was hoping it would.
customer_reviews.author: Max W.

customer_reviews.title: Great radio
customer_reviews.text: This is so far the best fm/dmr dual band portable radio built in China. Thecapacity of 100 hundred thousand IDs allowed me to input the dmr data base with 97 thousand ID. The colorful display is big and very informative. High capacity battery allow radio to work for two days with no charge.
customer_reviews.author: ad4c

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: Came with programming software. Can be programmed from key pad. Sounds better on Digital Voice than any radio I have used. Received great reports on my audio. Took about 15 minutes, from the time I submitted application for my DMR ID, to get confirmation and ID number.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great radio for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I have been a Ham radio operator for over 40 years. I recently got into DMR. This little radio has so many features it will take a time to learn them all. The programming is not too difficult if you know the basics, otherwise it would be a good idea to find someone to help you.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Allen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little radio
customer_reviews.text: I've had this radio for a couple of weeks and have created a codeplug that includes most of the areas that I travel to and through including my work frequencies. Now I can use this at work instead of the heavy bulky motorola radio that I used to carry. The software takes a bit of patience to get the hang of like any new radio. I'm happy with this radio and the seller. I had a few questions when I first started setting up the radio and the seller responded with in a couple hours. Now I'm looking at another one of these for my wife (also a ham) for when we travel.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Beere

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful screen and more
customer_reviews.text: I also have a TYT MD380 which I like, but the screen on this Anytone is so much better and the audio too. Battery life is excellent, much better than my other HTs -Kenwood TH74D and way way better than my FT-70D. This is a quality DMR HT and my daily carry. You will enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Scott

customer_reviews.title: This radio is easy to program compared to many other digital HTs
customer_reviews.text: This radio is easy to program compared to many other digital HTs. Good TX range at high power and RX is as sensitive as my other HTs. I recommend this for anyone wanting a full function DMR radio for thousands less than the commercial units.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: A solid well built radio with complete front panel programming capability.
customer_reviews.text: The AnyTone AT-D878-UV is all the rage now with it’s Bluetooth capability. Most D868’s can be converted to 878’s if you are tech savvy. Either way, this is still a great rig for the money.
customer_reviews.author: J. P.

customer_reviews.title: Quality! You pay for what you get!
customer_reviews.text: Received as gift, from family member, Purchased it for same family member after he received his ticket. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beast Mode DMR
customer_reviews.text: This radio is a beast. Great Audio. Very Clear and Loud. Awesome signal to the LOCAL DMR repeater about 15 miles away. Tons of memory. Easy to use and the battery last for 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very Nice DMR/analog radio for under two hundred buck. Does not receive am.
customer_reviews.author: Gman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent DMR/Analog dual band.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for use on my DMR hotspots (home and work) as well as analog repeaters in the area.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen C. West-fisher

customer_reviews.title: Anytone AT-868UV GPS
customer_reviews.text: This is what I was looking for and it is a great radio for the money. The programming software is easy to work with as well. Buy it , you will like it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the cost
customer_reviews.text: Like the color display. I use it to talk on DMR repeaters and also use my OpenSpot 2 with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Radio for DMR
customer_reviews.text: Excellent radio for DMR!! Came with the CPS programming software and cable to program in Talk Groups and Zones!
customer_reviews.author: Juddie

customer_reviews.title: You can't go wrong buying the Anytone ATD-868UV.
customer_reviews.text: Great DMR/analog handheld. Battery life is great. Menus are easy and intuitive. Screen is bright and easy to read. Programming software is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Chema

customer_reviews.title: Great radio for the price. Very happy with with the Radio and seller.
customer_reviews.text: Product was better than expected. This is my new goto radio as it is well built and the firmware just keeps getting better. It is great to have the ability to import other radios codeplugs such as tyt etc into this radio. The seller is A+ and I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: John Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent radio so far! Programming could be easier, however, it isn't all that bad.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Root

customer_reviews.title: Awesome radio. Couldn’t be more happier.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome radio. Works great easy to program perfect size love this radio.
customer_reviews.author: BUDDY

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome radio. Software releases every week or two and it's getting better.
customer_reviews.author: G

product_meta.title: AnyTone AT-D868UV GPS Version II Updated firmware Upgraded 3100mAh Battery Dual Band DMR/Analog 144 & 480 MHz Radio
product_meta.description: Functions: True-2-slot: Provide 2-slot communication which allows for 2 talk paths on 1 frequency; Comply with MOTOTRBO Tier I&II Power: 6W/2.5W/0.5W Auto-senses digital or analog 4000 channels + VFO; Contact list Display: 1.77 inches TFT color LCD, dual display; dual standby; dual PA Bandwidth: 12.5K/25K (Analog); 12.5K (DMR) Fixed and defined CTCSS/DCS encode and decode DTMF/2TONE/5TONE encode and decode Four different Tone-pulse frequencies Individual/Group/All call Icon indicator or Voice prompt when connecting with repeater Display the Caller ID and name Encryption function SMS via keyboard, One touch call/text Zone selection; Recording, GPS (option) ANI function and PTT ID; VOX Emergency alarm (with GPS data transmission) Earphone: KENWOOD connector; Battery: 3100mAh Li-ion thick battery. TX and RX frequency range 136-174 MHz and 400-480 MHz. Package Includes: AnyTone AT-D868UV GPS "Version 2"dual-band DMR/Analog radio USB Programming Cable and software Dual Band Antenna Li-ion Battery 3100mAh Belt Clip Charger base and AC Adapter User's Manual
feature_bullets: To fully utilize all the features you have to use Windows PC to program this radio. Not Compatible with CHIRP and RT systems software.

The AnyTone D868UV GPS "Version 2" Dual Band radio was developed to conform to the DMR Tier I and II requirements. It offers state-of-the-art performance for both digital and analog operation at both the UHF and VHF frequency band. The radio has been certified by FCC under Part 90 standards and offers 4,000 Channels, 10,000 Digital Talk Groups with 200,000 Contacts.

The large color display offers clear information about the radio operation and function, including displaying whom you are connected to. The powerful transmitter is very reliable and offers up to 7 Watts of power for a hand-held.

Package Includes: AnyTone AT-D868UV GPS "Version 2"dual-band DMR/Analog radio, USB Programming Cable and software, Dual Band Antenna, 3100mAh Li-ion Battery, Belt Clip, Charger base and AC Adapter, User's Manual.
TX and RX frequency range 136-174 MHz and 400-480 MHz FCC ID:T4KD868UV
